intro: Tragopyrum mucronatum, commonly known as the slender thistle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant features spiny, lanceolate leaves with a rough texture, and its flowers are typically yellow, arranged in a clustered inflorescence. Tragopyrum mucronatum is adapted to arid and rocky environments, demonstrating resilience to harsh climatic conditions. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and nectar sources for various pollinators.
